newsitem.title: USA: TVA study looks at Bellefonte options.
newsitem.headline: TVA study looks at Bellefonte options.

text.p: The Tennessee Valley Authority said it has released a study examining the possible environmental impacts of five options for converting the Bellefonte Nuclear Plant to use fossil fuels to produce electricity.
TVA said a public meeting on the draft environmental impact statement will be held at the Scottsboro High School Auditorium Tuesday evening.
The statement evaluates the options of converting the plant to use combinations of different fossil fuels -- coal, natural gas, low-sulfur distillate oil and petroleum coke.

TVA said three of the options involve converting coal or petroleum coke into a gas before burning it to produce electricity. Two of these options would also use the gas to produce chemical by-products to be sold commercially.
TVA said its staff will recommend a preferred option after considering the environmental impact, along with a separate economic and technical evaluation of the proposed conversion.
It noted nuclear options for Bellefonte have not been ruled out, including completing the plant with a partner.
